pr_title: [CALCITE-3852] RexSimplify doesn't simplify NOT EQUAL predicates

timeline.bodyText:
I think this logic could be applicable in other unknownAs modes
In case you want to do this only in UAF (this case) you may go further...and get into nulls.
However I think that it would be better to move this out from this method into a method which is run for all simplifyAnd-s and do it generally .
timeline.author: kgyrtkirk

timeline.message: [CALCITE-3852] RexSimplify doesn't simplify NOT EQUAL predicates
[CALCITE-3852] RexSimplify doesn't simplify NOT EQUAL predicates

timeline.author: hsyuan

timeline.bodyText:
this can't happen. Please see the Comparison constructor
please remove:

the literal.getValue() == null checks
and also the "check for comparision with null values" comment; which (after the removal) will be entirely misleading

Note that: in case the literal is null; comparisions are simplifed because they are Strong.
timeline.author: kgyrtkirk

timeline.bodyText:
please remove this "nullable" boolean - and let other parts of RexSimplify do their tricks; please note that the UnknownAs.FALSE case is not yet handled; I know in case of a second invokation of RexSimplify; that will be done - but ideally; RexSimplify should not be able to do any more simplification on a result of a previously simplification.
construct the AND ; and call simplifyUnknownAs(andNode, unknownAs)
timeline.author: kgyrtkirk

timeline.bodyText:
I believe the current simplification logic could be extended to also handle the case when we have an a!=0 predicate; and we have an a!=0 node to simplify.
this wasn't working before this patch; so it's entirely optional...
timeline.author: kgyrtkirk

replies.bodyText: I am a little busy recently. So I prefer next pr to do it when I am free.
replies.author: chunweilei
